title: What kind of songs do you listen to? - Quora

response.answer_text: My taste in music is a little all over the place: I listen to progressive rock (Pink Floyd, Steven Wilson, Porcupine Tree), regular rock (Scoprions, Breaking Benjamin, Beatles, Welshly Arms), alternative (Mother Mother, Ninet Tayeb). I also do enjoy some flavors of pop (Christina Perri, Jem, Imagine Dragons, Melanie Martinez, Weyes Blood), Latin pop (Juanes, Cafe Tacvba, Carla Morrison) and I love classical music (Chopin, Debussy, etc) especially when I'm playing it. Mostly Heavy Metal and Rock but that doesn't mean that I don't like artists from other genres. I highly enjoy some electronic artists like: Daft Punk and Aphex Twin or even hip-hop artists like: Kendrick Lamar, Nas, Notorious BIG, Tupac,Jay Z Eminem,Kanye West,Death Grips & Childish Gambino. My favorite Pop singers are: The Weeknd & Frank Ocean. Here are my favorite rock artists: AC/DCAlice in ChainsArctic MonkeysThe BeatlesBob DylanThe ClashCreamDavid BowieThe DoorsEric ClaptonThe Jimi Hendrix ExperienceLed ZeppelinNirvanaNine Inch NailsPink FloydRadioheadRed Hot Chili PeppersThe Rolling StonesThe WhoNow for my favorite Heavy Metal bands: BehemothBlack SabbathDeftonesDeathDioGhostIron MaidenJudas PriestMegadethMetallicaPanteraRage Against The MachineSlayerSystem of A DownTool

I tend to listen to a lot of music that sounds like the Beatles. There is a whole subgenre of independent music that is Beatlesque, and most of it is unknown to the general public. If you’re interested in the Beatles sound, I’d recommend Jellyfish, Mike Viola and the Candy Butchers, the Nines, Susanna Hoffs, Bleu, Jason Falkner and David Myhr. Of course, power pop overlaps some here, but the artists I’ve mentioned tend to be a little more McCartney than Lennon - i.e., lighter with fewer power chords. Other than that, I still listen to 80s music. I grew up in a rural area so I missed out on the whole post-punk/college radio movement. I still have a lot to cover.

I listen to Hindi songs mostly and sometimes I also listen English songs. Anyway I mostly listen emotional songs. My favourite singer is Atif Aslam. I listen to all types of songs, ranging from jazz to rock to electronic. But within these, there are specific sub genres that I like a lot. In Electronic - I really like Brazilian Bass, a different style of deep house. This style is very characteristic and famous in Brazil, hence the name. Song examples:   In Rock: I am into to the classics, but I hate heavy rock. All for the chill rock. Examples:   In Jazz: Brazil has some great music. And probably on top of the ladder comes Bossa Nova. I am not sure if you can call Bossa Nova a sub genre of jazz, I consider it it’s own genre, but some people find it easier to relate to a known style such as jazz. Examples:   Hope you like them!

Before I start off with answering the question I hope you all get it clear that K-Pop is not shit. I mean it's not like if you don't understand the language or their culture it becomes shit. Anyway, So honestly I do not listen to much of K-Pop except BTS. Answering the question, I listen to songs that make me happy, not emotional. I listen to songs that make me love me and not someone else. I listen to songs that make me keep my eyes open and appreciate my surrounding, even the wall, not making me close my eyes and think of the past memories. Of course a part of the fandom are toxic and I get it if you hate K-pop bcoz of their fandom. But honestly every fandom has some toxic fans and since K-pop has a huge fandom, naturally the numbers are more. But the songs have really amazing lyrics, all deep and meaningful. I listen to such songs. Apart from BTS there's another song that's my kind “Fight song”.

A very interesting question! I see answers here that approach the matter from totally different perspectives. For example, one put it in terms of where he found the songs. So I may as well put forth yet another view: These days, I’m thinking that my feelings toward songs have less to do with what I like, and are more about what I hate. Hate is a strong word, and my use of it here is fully intentional. There is music I really do hate, and this reflects the way I’m recently encountering thinking that I hate in all of life, as I explore the world of ideas more widely. You may find this mysterious. I wish I could clarify. I’d like to give examples. But now I’m going to say something that may frustrate you. I’m going to say I’m going to avoid examples. For now. That’s because this is breaking news in my life, and if I were to tell you more specifics, I might be saying things that I’d have to walk back, just a little farther on. Sorry, but I’ll just have to leave it at that for now. Yes, there is lots of music I do listen to because I really do like it, and usually for quite light-hearted reasons. In fact, some of it is frankly sappy stuff. I know it’s only rock and roll, but I like it…Those tastes of mine have really not changed that much since, oh, age 20 at the latest, and mostly much earlier than that. But then there are those truly awful songs that say things I seriously hate…

Anything that sounds good. I don’t care what genre they are country, rap, hip hop, edm, etc. I also like listening to mashups, 2 or more songs put together. I use SoundCloud to listen to my music. It isn’t at all how I thought it would be (shitty mumble rappers) there’s actually good music on there. Some songs are: Angels Vs FFYL (Chance The Rapper X Quinn XCII) XXXTENTACION - CURSE Feat. Bass Santana, Kin$oul (Audio) Zara Larsson - Ain't My Fault (TULE Remix) ♫ Sub Urban - Cradles Psychic Type - You Alone Cheat Codes For Hoes (ft.Traqula) Kamiyada - Tale Of A Ghost AVSTIN JAMES - Ark Night (Chance The Rapper X Zookeepers & Shipwreck) Glad You Came time flies remix

My taste in music is a little all over the place. I Love Melody songs(Passengers, Sia, John Legend, Lukas Graham, Charlie Puth, Zayn, etc) and I also love pop music(Rihanna, Maroon5, Britney Spears, Taylor Swift, Jenifer Lopez, Shakira, Justin Bieber, Ed Sheeran, Shawn Mendes), I do love some 80s music (Queen, Elvis Presley, Micheal Jackson), And last but not the least, Spanish songs(Luis Fonsi, Daddy Yankee, Enrique Iglesias ) and many more. Songs are pretty much my whole life…

From quiet and romantic to heavy metal. From AC/DC to Coldplay I have a strange varsity in my playlist but I love listening to English songs habitually. Fin.

Well it all depends on my mood  Happy mood = happy songs Sad mood = sad songs Traveling at night = old romantic songs Traveling day time =dhinchak songs With husband =romantic songs Cooking time= trending on charts  So what's your mood playlist

I have an eclectic taste in music. I will happily listen to just about any genre of music that makes me tap my toes, gets my head banging, has cleverly written/thought provoking lyrics or implores me to dance around the house like I'm 7 years old again but I often refuse to like mainstream music that is forcibly pushed into my ears by commercial radio stations I cannot escape from at my workplace.

I don't know what to call it but I like songs that make me feel free. Ones that explain me like knowing there is someone out here who will be there for me and that I'm not alone. For example; Glass House by RED which explains how I want to be whole again. These kinds of songs always make me happy and sometimes even cry but they are my favourite kinds of songs so I hope this helped you! :)

I listen to a little bit of everything, music is therapy for my soul. I believe in the saying that music does not have an experation date, so don't be afraid to pull up some good music from the past. song's could be anything from migos slippery or the bee gees heaven… depends on my mood that particular day.

I am incredibly picky about my music so the artists I listen to have to be imaginative and imbue a lot of depth into their work. To that end, my favorite artist is The Dear Hunter. They have 5 of 6 acts out currently that express an ingenious narrative and an incredible amount of creativity with the intrumentals. I have also been listening to Nothing More a lot recently. In This Moment’s album “Ritual” that released this year is really good, as well as Disturbed's newest album. On the flip side, I have grown bored of Five Finger Death Punch and Avenged Sevenfold. Their newest albums seemed to lack any new ingenuity.

I like to listen to songs that Josh Groban sings. He has a beautiful voice. I was supposed to go to a concert of his called Bridges Tour. It was postponed because of the Corona Virus. I was sad, but but it was better thst it was postponed to be safe. It will be rescheduled and I will be happy to see it.

This is my music ranking, and I am a Chinese. The classics are timeless,borderless and limitless. Mariah is not as talented as she used to be, and these songs are maybe outmoded,but it still has the magic to make me addicted to her voices, even for the whole life. There will never be anyone like her.
I usually listen to kpop, pop, western classical and lofi.  I try to find music which is relaxing and these are the genres that I find amusing.

Alot of 70s era progressive rock. The reason for it is that rock music of that time seemed to be riding that wave of the psychedelic movement of the 60s, but expanding on it in musical structure and lyrical content. Some of my favorites are Close to the Edge by Yes, Trilogyby ELP, Starless by King Crimson, and The Pinnacle by Kansas.

Hello Songs have always been important in my life… Songs which are soothing and pleasant, make me happy and create a peaceful atmosphere around me. Eg. Hope you got your answer here… Thank you!

I'm into many of them. English, Punjabi, French, Hindi, Korean, Arabic. Punjabi songs top my list, they're much about your friends, your parents and love friend. As much as I've learnt so far, they're hardly any depressing, of course as long as the lyrics won't mean so. 3 Peg by Sharry Mann is such a dope. It's a hit all over the world who know of Punjabi music.
